description: Initialize a new Git repository in the current directory.
Clone a repository from a remote URL to local machine.
Shallow clone (only latest commit, saves time/space).
List all remote repositories with URLs.
Add all modified and new files to staging area.
Add all files (including deleted) to staging area.
Add modified and deleted files (no new files).
Remove file from working directory and staging area.
Remove file from staging area only (keep in working directory).
Move or rename a file and stage the change.
Commit staged changes with a message.
Stage all modified files and commit with message.
Amend commit without changing commit message.
Show diff of changes in commit message editor.
Show commit history in compact format.
Show commit history with branch graph.
Show all branches history with graph.
Show commit history with diff patches.
Show commit history with file statistics.
Search commits that added or removed specific string.
Show commit history for specific file.
Show information about a specific commit.
Show information about the latest commit.
Show file content at specific commit.
Show unstaged changes in working directory.
Show staged changes (difference between staging and last commit).
Show all changes (staged and unstaged) since last commit.
Show only names of changed files.
Show word-level differences instead of line-level.
Show who last modified each line of a file.
Show blame for specific lines (10 to 20).
Summarize git log output by author.
Show logs with file list of each commit.
List branches with last commit info.
Create new branch and switch to it.
Create new branch from specific commit/branch.
Create new branch and switch to it (Git 2.23+).
Force delete branch (even if not merged).
List branches merged into current branch.
List branches not merged into current branch.
Set upstream branch for current branch.
Merge specified branch into current branch.
Merge with no fast-forward (always create merge commit).
Merge only if fast-forward is possible.
Squash all commits from branch into single commit.
Abort merge in case of conflicts.
Find common ancestor of two branches.
Reapply commits on top of another branch.
Abort rebase and return to original state.
Rebase specific range of commits onto new base.
Apply latest stash without removing it.
Apply latest stash and remove it from stash list.
Remove latest stash from stash list.
Stash all files including ignored files.
Create lightweight tag on current commit.
Push all tags to remote repository.
Checkout tag (puts you in detached HEAD state).
Download objects and refs from remote repository.
Remove remote-tracking references that no longer exist on remote.
Fetch and merge changes from remote.
Pull with rebase instead of merge.
Pull only if fast-forward is possible.
Push local commits to remote repository.
Safer force push (only if remote hasn't changed).
Alternative way to delete remote branch.
Reset to commit, keep changes staged.
Reset to commit, keep changes unstaged (default).
Reset to commit, discard all changes (dangerous).
Undo last commit and discard changes.
Create new commit that undoes changes of specified commit.
Show what would be removed (dry run).
Discard changes in working directory for specific file.
Restore file to state in latest commit.
Restore file to state in specific commit.
Set user name for current repository.
Set user email for current repository.
Create alias to show last commit.
Set default branch name to main.
Set pull to use rebase by default.
Update submodules to remote's latest commit.
Start binary search to find bug-introducing commit.
Mark current commit as bad (contains bug).
Mark specific commit as good (no bug).
End bisect session and return to original branch.
Apply changes from specific commit to current branch.
Add reference to original commit in message.
Show reference log (history of HEAD changes).
Run garbage collection (clean up unnecessary files).
Verify integrity of Git file system.
Count unpacked objects and display sizes.
Show help for specific Git command.
Describe current commit with nearest tag.
Describe using abbreviated commit hash if no tag.
Show root directory of Git repository.
Create bundle file for offline transfer.
Run Git daemon for anonymous access.
List branches sorted by last commit date.
Show information about files in index.
Build tree from ls-tree formatted text.
